== Screencast ==

A <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Screencast|screencast]]</nowiki> is a digital recording of your computer desktop. This is helpful for when creating tutorial and instructional materials, demonstrate how to reproduce a bug, and demonstrating the latest desktop software.

== Screencasting software ==

=== kazam ===

<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/kazam|Kazam]]</nowiki> is an easy to use application for recording on-screen action.

=== recordmydesktop ===

<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/recordmydesktop|Recordmydesktop]]</nowiki> captures audio and video data of a Linux desktop session.

=== ffmpeg ===

<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/ffmpeg|ffmpeg]]</nowiki> allows recording the screen via the command line. For instructions, please see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ScreenCasts/ffmpeg|here]]</nowiki>.

=== peek ===

<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/peek|peek]]</nowiki> is a simple animated GIF screen recorder with GUI.
